events.title: 53 people dead or missing after migrant boat capsizes in Mediterranean
events.description: Only two survivors rescued after boat overturned off Libyan coast, UN migration agency says Fifty-three people are dead or missing after a boat capsized in the Mediterranean Sea off the Libyan coast, the UN migration agency said on Monday. The International Organization for Migration said the boat overturned north of Zuwara on Friday, in the latest disaster involving people attempting the perilous Mediterranean crossing in the hope of reaching Europe. events.title: RSF drone attack kills 24 people fleeing fighting in central Sudan, says doctors group
events.description: Eight children including two infants among dead in vehicle carrying displaced people, says Sudan Doctors Network A drone attack by a paramilitary group has hit a vehicle carrying displaced families in central Sudan, killing at least 24 people, including eight children, a doctors‚Äô group said on Saturday. The attack by the Rapid Support Forces took place close to the city of Er Rahad in North Kordofan province, according to the Sudan Doctors Network, which tracks the country‚Äôs war. The vehicle was transporting displaced people who fled fighting in the Dubeiker area, the group said in a statement. Among the dead children were two infants. Continue reading...

events.title: Weather tracker: Spain and Portugal hit by third deadly storm in two weeks
events.description: Storm Marta sweeps Iberian peninsula just days after Storms Kristin and Leonardo brought deadly flooding and major damage Spain and Portugal have endured another storm over the weekend, just days after the deadly flooding and major damage caused by Storm Kristin and Storm Leonardo last week. Storm Marta passed over the Iberian peninsula on Saturday, bringing fresh torrential rain and killing two people. Storm Kristin killed at least five people after it made landfall on 28 January with Storm Leonardo claiming another victim last Wednesday . The outlook for this week is for more rain across Spain, Portugal and France, especially across north-west Portugal, where more than 100mm is possible during the first half of the week. Some of the heaviest of the rain will transfer to southern Italy and western parts of Greece and Turkey later in the week. Continue reading...

events.title: One small step for women in space, one giant leap for equality
events.description: With French female astronaut Sophie Adenot joining the crew at the International Space Station, it is the perfect moment to reflect on the role of women in space; a field still very much dominated by men. Yet years before Adenot set her sights on a career in space, other women were actively involved in the sector. But despite their achievements in computing, engineering and even on board the launches, many of their names have been forgotten by history. Annette Young also talks to Meganne Christian, a fellow British-Australian astronaut who‚Äôs been training with Adenot, on gender differences in space.

events.title: Weather tracker: cyclones hit Australia and Madagascar and -40C cold snap in northern Europe
events.description: Western Australia and Madagascar struck by destructive winds and rain, while Finland and Norway have coldest January since 2010 Tropical Cyclone Mitchell hit the coast of Western Australia last week. It initially developed as a weak tropical low over the Northern Territory in early February, then tracked eastwards over Western Australia‚Äôs Kimberley region and eventually reached the Indian Ocean. Fuelled by warm waters, Mitchell intensified into a tropical cyclone and moved south-west, hugging the coast of Western Australia and eventually deepened to a category three storm. Continue reading...

events.title: Ecuadorian leaves, Argentine protests and other top photos from Latin America and the Caribbean
events.description: Feb. 6-12, 2026 Ramon Pucha demonstrated how to turn a leaf into a hat to protect himself from the sun while looking for seeds to grow on his family‚Äôs farm, where he preserves native species and shares seedlings with neighboring communities in an effort to protect biodiversity, in Ecuador‚Äôs Amazon region. Students led a march on National Youth Day in Caracas, Venezuela, to call for the release of detainees who are considered political prisoners by their relatives and human rights groups. Workers mobilized by trade unions converged in a Buenos Aires square, blocking traffic and clashing with police as Argentina‚Äôs Senate debated and ultimately approved a labor overhaul. This gallery was curated by photographer Esteban Felix, based in Santiago, Chile. ___ AP photography: https://apnews.com/photography Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/apnews

events.title: New leader targets immigration in first comments after spill ‚Äì as it happened
events.description: This blog is now closed New opposition leader Taylor wants to stop ‚Äòbad immigration‚Äô but says Liberals aren‚Äôt ‚ÄòOne Nation lite‚Äô Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast So far we know that Jane Hume and Dan Tehan will run for the deputy, but there are other names that are being floated. One of those was Tim Wilson (who‚Äôs often made light of one day leading the party), but he ruled himself out this morning. It brings none of us any joy to challenge Sussan. She has tried her very best. She has a very long and successful political career. As I say, this very difficult times, and I really did feel for her yesterday ‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm not going to engage in disparagement of Sussan this morning, I‚Äôve spoken before about the fact that we were not traveling well, and things have gone from bad to worse. We‚Äôre simply not competitive. I‚Äôm really hoping that under Angus leadership, we will move very quickly to show what we stand for in terms of our migration policy, housing and of course, education. Continue reading...

events.title: Pakistan: Imran Khan to be examined over vision loss claims
events.description: The Supreme Court order to examine Khan comes after his attorney told media that the former prime minister had lost most of his vision in his right eye. Khan has been in prison since 2023 due to a graft case conviction.

events.title: When Haute Couture breaks with tradition: Summer 2026 collections
events.description: Across the discipline, designers are breathing fresh perspectives into Haute Couture. Kevin Germanier repurposes Berluti outfits worn by the French Olympic team. St√©phane Rolland encourages model Farnoush Hamidian to talk out about her native Iran. Julien Fourni√© extols the virtues of diversity. Yuima Nakazato battles AI with dresses made of ceramics. Charlie le Mindu makes masterpieces from hair. Finally, Imane Ayissi expresses his African identity through an unveiling of the creative process.

events.title: Paris's Cit√© des Sciences soars with excitement over Crew‚Äë12 launch
events.description: The Cit√© des Sciences in Paris watched the Crew‚Äë12 launch with excitement as astronauts headed to the ISS. Raphael Li√©gois, French astronaut, shared his insights on the mission with France 24‚Äôs Claire Paccalin, highlighting the thrill and significance of the lift‚Äëoff.

events.title: Who is Tarique Rahman, Bangladesh's election winner ?
events.description: Bangladesh‚Äôs BNP wins a decisive majority, with Tarique Rahman set to lead after the 2024 uprising ousted Sheikh Hasina. Returning from 17 years abroad, he pledges unity, aid expansion, and political reforms.

events.title: From Haigner√© to Adenot: The story of French astronauts
events.description: French astronaut Sophie Adenot has just taken off to become the second French woman in space, 30 years after Claudie Haigner√©, embarking on a nine-month mission aboard the ISS‚Äîthe longest ever French spaceflight. Her journey is the latest chapter in France‚Äôs history of astronauts, from Jean-Loup Chr√©tien in 1982 to Thomas Pesquet, inspiring a new generation of explorers. Adenot reflects on the legacy of French space pioneers and the excitement of sharing this mission with the public.

events.title: Macron calls for 'mandatory electoral bans' for people guilty of anti-Semitic or racist acts
events.description: French President Emmanuel Macron on Friday called for those found guilty of anti-Semitic or racist acts or remarks to receive "mandatory electoral bans". Macron was speaking on the 20-year anniversary of the kidnapping, torture and murder of French Jewish man Ilan Halimi.

events.title: Epstein's victims feared he secretly filmed them - emails suggest they were right
events.description: Sky News has found an email exchange from 2014 showing that convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein asked a member of staff to install hidden video cameras at his home in Palm Beach, Florida.

events.title: Bollywood and the mafia: A toxic and deadly affair
events.description: A nexus between Bollywood and the Mafia, a one-sided toxic and deadly affair ‚Äì with just one winner.

events.title: Who is Kim Ju Ae? The teenager who could be North Korea's next leader
events.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un is appearing to take steps to name his daughter as his official successor.

events.title: Who is Matt Weston? The athlete going for Team GB's first gold at Winter Olympics
events.description: Going into the men's singles skeleton final, Team GB's Matt Weston is in prime position to win the UK's first medal at this year's games.

events.title: Winter Olympics live: Team GB hope for first medal of the Games
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Thailand‚Äôs ruling conservative party moves closer to forming new coalition government
events.description: Thailand‚Äôs Bhumjaithai Party has moved closer to forming a new government after the Pheu Thai Party agreed to join it in a proposed coalition

events.title: Thousands rally in support of Nepal's former king and call for monarchy's return
events.description: Thousands of supporters have gathered outside Kathmandu airport to greet former king Gyanendra Shah and demand Nepal restore the monarchy

events.title: Mosque gunman wanted online fame. A New Zealand court has tried to curb that
events.description: New Zealand's Court of Appeal has finished hearing an appeal from the Christchurch mosque gunman, in proceedings that were quiet and tightly controlled

events.title: During the Winter Games, some Milan churches are teaching Olympic values to thousands of kids
events.description: A Milan church uses the buzz around the 2026 Winter Olympics to teach kids that sports values matter in everyday life

events.title: Judge orders jailed Guatemalan journalist Jos√© Rub√©n Zamora returned to house arrest
events.description: A judge has ordered that Guatemalan journalist Jos√© Rub√©n Zamora be returned to house arrest again while awaiting trial after spending nearly a year in jail in his latest stint of incarceration

events.title: A judge has ordered the release of jailed Guatemalan journalist Jos√© Rub√©n Zamora
events.description: A judge has ordered the release of jailed Guatemalan journalist Jos√© Rub√©n Zamora

events.title: Women and girls in science: Dismantling barriers, closing gender gaps
events.description: Although women are more likely than young men to pursue higher education, they make up only 35 per cent of science graduates.

events.title: In Bahrain; work, dignity and the quiet rise of home-grown enterprise
events.description: From a crochet hook in a Cairo living room to digital marketplaces reaching across borders, women entrepreneurs are demonstrating how creativity, persistence and targeted support can translate into livelihoods ‚Äî even when formal employment is out of reach.

events.title: New Jersey teacher who slept with students at family bagel shop learns prison sentence
events.description: Former New Jersey teacher Julie Rizzitello sentenced to 10 years in prison for sexually assaulting two students she groomed at Wall High School.

events.title: Democrats push 'unconstitutional power grab' that could flip GOP seats and more top headlines
events.description: Get all the stories you need-to-know from the most powerful name in news delivered first thing every morning to your inbox.

events.title: Former FBI agent calls holster setup in Nancy Guthrie case 'incredibly amateur and unsafe'
events.description: Former FBI agents question an "amateur and unsafe" holster setup in Nancy Guthrie case surveillance video, calling the configuration dangerous.

events.title: K-9 hit by vehicle during bank robbery chase keeps going and helps capture suspect
events.description: A Georgia K-9 Robbi was struck by a car during a bank robbery chase but kept pursuing the suspect until capture. The brave dog is expected to recover.

events.title: European nation votes to cap population at 10M in major immigration crackdown referendum
events.description: Switzerland will vote June 14 on capping population at 10 million as anti-immigration referendum gains momentum with population nearing 9.1 million.

events.title: Uproar after Iran named vice-chair of UN body promoting democracy, women‚Äôs rights
events.description: Iran's appointment as vice-chair of UN Commission for Social Development faces sharp criticism from human rights advocates and Iranian activists calling it a 'mockery'.

events.title: US forces complete withdrawal from strategic al-Tanf Garrison in Syria
events.description: The U.S. military has completed its withdrawal from al-Tanf Garrison in southern Syria, handing over control to government forces.

events.title: Iranian brutality: Nobel laureate fighting for life after barbaric assault at notorious prison
events.description: The Nobel Committee is demanding Iran stop alleged brutal abuse of peace laureate Narges Mohammadi, who has been imprisoned since December after attending a funeral.

events.title: Trump meets Netanyahu, says he wants Iran deal but reminds Tehran of ‚ÄòMidnight Hammer‚Äô operation
events.description: President Donald Trump and Israeli prime minister signal uncertainty on Iran diplomacy after White House talks, with Trump pushing negotiations while keeping other options open.

events.title: Trump, Netanyahu to meet at White House in high-stakes talks on Iran, Gaza plan
events.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu meets President Donald Trump Wednesday to discuss Iran negotiations, as Washington weighs diplomacy against military action.

events.title: Nicaragua blocks pathway used by Cuban migrants to reach the US
events.description: Nicaragua blocks Cuban citizens from entering without visas, eliminating a key migration route to the U.S. border through Central America and Mexico.
